$HYPE rose >6% to $22.89, holding above short-term support near $20. On-chain data shows a whale transfer of 665,000 #HYPE (~$14.5M) to Bybit, while other large wallets accumulate around yield mechanics. 

Derivatives activity increased: Open Interest +18% to $1.82B, trading volume +24%.

Momentum indicators point to renewed buying. Price near descending-channel resistance at $24; breakout could target $30 then $40, failure may extend consolidation.

#HYPE #Crypto #Altcoins #BingX #DeFi #OnChain #Trading

$HYPE Price Update


HYPE is trading at $22.89, up more than 6% in the past 24 hours, holding above short-term support near $20.


On-chain data shows a large transfer of 665,000 HYPE (approximately $14.5 million) to an exchange, suggesting possible profit-taking. Meanwhile, other large holders continue to accumulate, indicating ongoing interest.


Derivatives activity has increased, with open interest rising 18% to $1.82 billion and trading volume up 24%, pointing to higher market participation.


Technically, $HYPE is approaching resistance near $24. A breakout above this level could open the way toward $30, with a higher target near $40. Failure to break resistance may lead to continued consolidation.


Momentum indicators currently suggest renewed buying pressure.

HYPE ($HYPE ): +10% in 24 hours â€” technical rebound or groundwork for new momentum?  HYPE remains in the market spotlight: the price is holding steady at around $23.3, adding about 10% over the past 24 hours. The growth is accompanied by an increase in trading activity â€” the daily volume exceeded $210 million. On a weekly timeframe, the movement looks ambiguous, and in a 30-day perspective, it is noticeable that the token is still going through a stabilization phase after the December correction from local highs. Market interest is gradually returning, without any pronounced FOMO, which can be seen as a healthy sign. The 4-hour chart shows a recovery pattern forming after a sharp decline to the $20â€“21 area, which acted as key support. The current rebound has allowed the price to return above $22.5, but the nearest serious resistance is in the $25â€“26 zone, where active position fixing was previously observed. So far, the movement looks like a technical retest, but a confident consolidation above $26 could change the picture in favor of a continuation of the trend. The probability of moderate growth in the medium term is estimated at approximately 55%, with interest and a stable market background remaining.  Against this backdrop, STONfi looks particularly relevant â€” a decentralized exchange in the TON ecosystem focused on fast and transparent on-chain operations. Unlike CEX, where users are dependent on the platform's internal rules, STONfi operates through smart contracts: without custodial storage, hidden restrictions, and with complete transparency of all actions. In periods of increased volatility, this becomes a key advantage. #HYPE  #CEX  #DEX

#Macro Insights# #BingX #Altcoin Season#

APP CHAINS GAIN TRACTION, FACE NETWORK INTEGRATION CHALLENGES

App chains are rising as top applications seek dedicated infrastructure. PolyMarket and Hyperliquid are building their own chains to control user experience, reduce costs, and capture more value at scale.

Public chains work early on, but congestion, volatile fees, and slow confirmations limit mature apps. Leading projects now treat the chain as part of the product itself.

The real challenge is not launching an app chain but making it functional. New chains face cold starts, fragmented liquidity, and weak ecosystem links. Success requires strong network integration from day one and built-in cross-chain connectivity. The value of app chains comes from how well they plug into the broader network, not just from existing as standalone chains.

#AppChains #ModularBlockchains
